title: Don't mix pregnancy with... aspirin
body: The EURO-PERISTAT report shows that Poland has one of the highest rates of cesarean section in Europe. Aspirin is a great medicine. It works antipyretic, anti-inflammatory and anticoagulant. Long could be exchanged what does good. Unfortunately, the list of side effects is also long. I tell most patients not to look at aspirin during pregnancy. Because the results of the study showed a correlation between pregnant women taking acetylsalicylic acid and the occurrence of serious complications. The most commonly described are: cleft palate, heart defects, lower birth weight of newborns. In addition, the risk of perinatal complications increases. There are single cases of pregnant women for whom I recommend aspirin - e.g. women with hypertension. Or if I know that in a previous pregnancy the baby did not grow (aspirin prevents hypotrophy).
